div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 261 Zougra (anc. Pellene), Achaea, 1859 (1186) Burial: c. 146 B.C. Contents: 985+ AR. In a bronze vase Aenianes: 1 triob. Lamia: 1 triob. Aetolia: 104 triob. Locri Opuntii: 11 triob. Boeotia: 32 triob.; 22 dr. Aegina: 3 dr. Corinth: 1 triob. Sicyon: 11 triob. Achaean League: 654 triob. Messene: 2 triob. Argos: 96 triob. Megalopolis: 47 triob. Disposition: Athens 771 Oeconomides, RBN 1968, pp. 132-7 (with quota- tion of early publications where the total is given as 9170 or 9171 pieces and a few other mints are listed)
